meanings.def: an explosion or a powerful movement of air caused by an explosion
examples: a bomb blast
27 schoolchildren were injured in the blast.
The blast ripped through the building.

meanings.def: a sudden strong movement of air
examples: A blast of hot air hit us as we stepped off the plane.
the wind’s icy blasts

meanings.def: a sudden loud noise, especially one made by a musical instrument that you blow, or by a whistle or a car horn
examples: three short blasts on the ship’s siren
The driver opened the door letting out a blast of Bob Marley.
He gave a short blast on his trumpet.
Blast for prison governors in judge’s report.

meanings.def: a very happy experience that is a lot of fun
examples: The party was a blast.
We had a blast at the party.

meanings.def: a piece of advertising or information that is sent to a large number of people at the same time by email
examples: They sent out email blasts and posted information on all their websites.

meanings.def: a person or thing from your past that you see, hear, meet, etc. again in the present
with the greatest possible volume or power
examples: She had the car stereo on at full blast.

idioms.def: a person or thing from your past that you see, hear, meet, etc. again in the present
with the greatest possible volume or power
examples: She had the car stereo on at full blast.

meanings.def: to violently destroy or break something into pieces, using explosives
examples: They blasted a huge crater in the runway.
They had to blast a tunnel through the mountain.
All the windows were blasted inwards with the force of the explosion.
The jumbo jet was blasted out of the sky.
Danger! Blasting in Progress!

meanings.def: to make a loud unpleasant noise, especially music
examples: blast (out) Music suddenly blasted out from the speakers.
blast something (out) The radio blasted out rock music at full volume.
The movie was blasted by all the critics.

meanings.def: to hit, kick or shoot somebody/something with a lot of force
examples: He blasted the ball past the goalie.
He blasted (= shot) the policeman right between the eyes.

meanings.def: to direct air, water, etc. at somebody/something with a lot of force
examples: Police blasted the demonstrators with water cannons.

meanings.def: to destroy something such as a plant with disease, cold, heat, etc.
examples: Their whole crop had been blasted by a late frost.

meanings.def: people sometimes say Blast! when they are annoyed about something
examples: Oh blast! The car won't start.
